data.title: Favorite Italian in Evansville
data.text: Angelos is my favorite Italian restaurant by far. We go every year for Valentine's Day and many other times throughout the year. I would suggest getting reservations but that can usually be done the day of. Their rolls and salad are to die for, I always just get spaghetti and ask for angel hair pasta and I have always been happy with it. My husband always gets the tortellini ala pesto and it is always wonderful as well. The setting is really pretty and elegant. The price is also very good, it's cheaper than Olive Garden and it's authentic Italian, not a chain. I highly recommend going here for any special occasion.

data.title: Great little Italian place.  We will be back!!
data.text: We enjoyed a wonderful meal at a  little Italian place we had never tried before.  Angelo's on main street did not disappoint.  We shared the crab cakes appetizer.  It was amazing.  I recommend it highly.  Our entrees did not disappoint either.  I had the Mediterranean seafood and my wife had the chicken Parmesan.   Portions were huge and loaded with wonderful flavor.  Atmosphere was fitting for an Italian restaurant with full wall murals featuring scenes from Italy. We  I will be back!!  It wasn't cheap, but really good Italian food never is.  Either way they earned their money with great food, service, and atmosphere

data.title: Lacks Authenticity!
data.text: The place looks like a decent Italian restaurant when you walk in but that's as far as it goes.  The garlic rolls are soaked in butter, the calamari was processed and frozen.   I will say the marinara sauce was not bad but not great.  The worst part was the veal.  I don't know where they get the veal cutlets but I've never had a more processed disgusting piece of veal in any other restaurant.  Would not go back.

data.title: Always good, every time, lunch or dinner.
data.text:
When we moved here ten years ago, I was introduced to this place by a friend, and my wife and I spent our first anniversary in Evansville here. It was a Friday night, we were later than most, due to a wedding ceremony I officiated, so we closed the place down. What a memorable evening, as the chef came out and talked with us, finally taking on a challenge to find a red wine my wife would like (she's drinks only white wine). He got close, but regardless, what fun we had! 

We've been there many times over the ten years we've been here, in the evening and also for lunch. And again last night, for my daughter's 17th birthday. Once again, great service, some of the best food in town.

data.title: Nice, small business
data.text: We really enjoyed our visit to Angelo's for supper.  The waiter was very attentive and answered questions well.  The chicken parmesan was delicious and we enjoyed the house garden salad as well. Much nicer than many chain restaurants!

data.title: Great food
data.text: My wife and I have eaten here numerous times. Both for lunch and dinner. Whether you want a meal or pizza, you won't be disappointed. Friendly staff, and very nice atmosphere.

data.title: I Recommend!
data.text:
We met here with a group of friends and their children. 

The atmosphere was great. The food was very good. The service was good. 

We started with the Italian salad which was perfectly fresh and just the right amount of dressing.  This was served with fresh baked bread which was fantastic.  The bread kept coming throughout the meal. 

The dishes varied from spaghetti to tortellini to lasagna to chicken parmigiana at our table and everyone was very pleased with their choices! 

Service was always at the table at the correct time and the meal flowed at an appropriate pace.  The server could have been a bit more friendly. All else was very good.

data.title: anniversary
data.text: waiters and owner were excellent representatives of their business...food was varied and all enjoyed their meals...wine list is extensive ...prompt service

data.title: Dinner with mom and dad celebrating Father's Day
data.text: My brothers and our wives took mom and dad to Angelo's the Saturday evening before Father's Day.  We made reservations for a table for eight.  Our table was ready immediately upon our arrival.  Menus were provided and the drink order was taken as soon as we were seated. The menu is varied enough that there is something for everyone.  My brother and sister-in-law have been to this restaurant a number of times. She recommended I try the chicken a'la crema. There were a number of different entrees ordered by our party.  All dinner items come with a house salad, served family style, and delicious garlic rolls.  If you empty your salad bowl more is promptly brought to your table.  My dinner was fantastically delicious. Servings were large enough to share a taste with others if you so desire.  Service throughout the meal was excellent.  There is a nice variety of deserts on the menu but we were all too full to give them a try on this visit. Everyone at our table thoroughly enjoyed our meal and the evening spent at Angelo's.  Give them a try, you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Old World Atmosphere & Italian Market
data.text: This restaurant also includes an Italian market.  The Old World atmosphere is fantastic and servers were  Italian as well. Very enjoyable experience.  I ordered Chicken Picatta, it was not pan seared first, somewhat bland & not the best. The overall experience was very good.  Will try it again.

data.title: For Everyone
data.text: I love Angelos, talk about a quaint- romantic- tucked away spot. I feel like its an atmosphere where I can get the closest to a little restaurant in Italy. The food is awesome with a couple of items on the menu that are just good. Great location for a date, anniversary, family, or friends. Service is average but I would recommend it to anyone. The location is great because you can take a walk downtown on the walkway or down to the river after dinner.

data.title: Mixed Opinions
data.text: My wife and I decided to try some place new.  When we arrived they ask if we had reservation,  we did not but they found us a table outside.  My wife liked what she ordered but I thought my meal was just average.  The service was good and the atmosphere sitting outside was great.

data.title: Great Dinner & Lunch and Server
data.text:
Went during the week for dinner. It was not busy at all, so we got a table right away. The server was super nice! She gave us recommendations for wine (which was amazingly good!). The waitress always made sure we were doing well, and she was friendly and helpful! I got chicken parmesan which was delicious and so much that I could not finish it all. The place was very nice. 

A day later, I went for lunch at Angelo's- it was also good, although not as good as dinner. I had a slice of pizza and a drink for a very reasonable price! Will definitely go back!

data.title: Haiku review
data.text:
Good value for the 
Money. Downtown location
Veal parmigiana 

Fettuccine good
Waitstaff was attentive yea
Portions are median

data.title: Scrumptious!
data.text: Took some friends to Angelos as a thank you for watching our dog while we were on vacation.  The staff was kind and attentive.  The food was outstanding with wonderful garlic rolls, and salad along with the fabulous meals!  Love this place!

data.title: Favorite Italian ever!
data.text: Never been disappointed. The food is out of this world delicious! The service is always exceptional as well. We love the chicken fettuccine Alfredo. The salad, rolls and other appetizers and desserts we've had are also great, but the Alfredo fettuccine is the best. Busier times or large parties should call ahead for reservations. I've heard the lunch buffet is good too, just haven't made it there for lunch.

data.title: Best Italian food in Evansville!!
data.text: We eat at Angelo's at least once a month and always have a great experience. The staff is professional and friendly and the Chicken Ala Crema is wonderful! There are so many chain restaurants in Evansville, it's nice to eat at a restaurant where the owner is actually greeting the customers.

data.title: SAVE YOUR MONEY,  PASS THIS PLACE BY
data.text: Save your money, the food was average at best, the service was horrible, took forever to get our food, sever was more interested in taking smoke breaks. NEVER going there again!!!!!!!!

data.title: Not as it seems
data.text: Dinner was terrible.  Appetizers were not as the menu states. Ordered the cheese ravioli for the children,  they could not eat them due to them being spicey. Also ordered the provalone wedges which came out as mozzarella sticks like at walmart. Everyones main course was decent but one. The seafood pasta was way over cooked, overloaded with mushroom stems, shrimp very hard and rubbery. I looked at reviews first but what I seen was not the same.

data.title: Wonderful Evening!
data.text: Wednesday evening following a UE game at the Ford Center, my husband and I walked to Angelo's. We got to the door and the sign said the restaurant closed at 9:00 and it was now 9:15.  The owner saw us at the door and invited us in even though they were closing.  We ordered rigatoni carbonera and toasted ravioli.  No one in the restaurant seemed irritated that we were keeping them over.  The waitress was so kind and the staff went out of their way to make it very nice.  The food was wonderful and no one even tried to hurry us out the door.  Angelo's is my favorite Italian restaurant and they are very accommodating.  We enjoyed our meal and the atmosphere is great.
